Package menu

Class MenuCreator

java.lang.Object
menu.MenuCreator
public class MenuCreator extends Object
Sets up a menu of specified options and requests input of options. First initialize the menuOptions Array. Second setup the cases for the options. Third call the displayMenu() method.
Version:
1.1
Author:
Ryan Baggs Created on @date 07-Oct-2020

  • Method Details

    • displayMenu

      protected void displayMenu()
      Displays the Menu and gets the user input passing that to the selection cases.

    • printOptions

      protected void printOptions​(String[] menuOptions)
      Enter the options that you would like to print out, prints out the specified Strings to the console.
      Parameters:
      menuOptions - To be displayed to the console.

    • selectionCases

      protected void selectionCases​(int option)
      Override to create selection of cases. Use switch statement and include the provided exit() method.
      Parameters:
      option - The user selected option that was input.

    • exit

      protected void exit()
      Exits the Menu and closes the Scanner.

    • exit

      protected void exit​(String exitMessage)
      Exits the Menu and closes the Scanner with optional message.
      Parameters:
      exitMessage - Optional message to print to the console while exiting.

    • invalidInput

      public void invalidInput()
      Prints statement to user to enter valid input.

    • printOutput

      public void printOutput​(ArrayList<String> output)
      Use to print an ArrayList of Strings as output to the console. Each string is separated by a new line.
      Parameters:
      output - to be printed to the console.

    • setMenuOptions

      public void setMenuOptions​(String[] menuOptions)
      Set the menu options to be displayed. List the options associated int values and include the exit option.
      Parameters:
      menuOptions - to be displayed.

    • getString

      public String getString()
      Gets the Scanner nextLine.
      Returns:
      the next line in the Scanner.

    • getInt

      public int getInt()
      Gets the Scanner nextInt value.
      Returns:
      the next int value in the Scanner.

    • getDouble

      public double getDouble()
      Gets the Scanner nextDouble value.
      Returns:
      the next double value in the scanner.
